sources.title: The Riverside Murder
sources.description: A British mystery. Alastair Sim: No, no, no, now stay out! Judy Gunn: Oh, you monster! Alastair Sim: Aye, from Loch Ness.

sources.title: THE RIVERSIDE MURDER video quality upgrade
sources.description: This version has much improved contrast and brightness compared to the existing IA copy, and it is in the standard MPEG4 (MP4) format. “Really good murder mystery” “Gripping mystery” “Checks the usual boxes” (IMDB reviews quotes). A lively second-feature whodunit with an above average cast. (see CAST NOTE) Based on the French novel “Les Six Hommes Morts.” IMDB rating 5.9. Directed by Albert Parker. Released in 1935 (UK only). Complete print. CAST NOTE: Alastair Sim’s feature film debut.

metadata.Plot: A gentleman is shot dead in his study. The police come in to solve the crime. A young detective weaves his way through danger and an intricate set of clues to catch the killer. Watch for the scene were a murder is committed by shooting a gun through a mail slot in a door. The climax is terrific and similar to Secret of the Blue Room.
metadata.Actors: Basil Sydney, Judy Gunn, Zoe Davis
